intro: Machaerina capillacea, commonly known as the silky machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
